PERSONAE.TITLE: Dramatis Personae
PERSONAE.PERSONA: SIWARD, Earl of Northumberland, general of the English forces.
SEYTON, an officer attending on Macbeth.
Lords, Gentlemen, Officers, Soldiers, Murderers, Attendants, and Messengers.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. A desert place.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Thunder and lightning. Enter three Witches

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ALL
SPEECH.LINE: Fair is foul, and foul is fair:
Hover through the fog and filthy air.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. A camp near Forres.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Alarum within. Enter DUNCAN, MALCOLM, DONALBAIN, LENNOX, with Attendants, meeting a bleeding Sergeant

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DUNCAN
SPEECH.LINE: What bloody man is that? He can report,
As seemeth by his plight, of the revolt
The newest state.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MALCOLM
SPEECH.LINE: This is the sergeant
Who like a good and hardy soldier fought
'Gainst my captivity. Hail, brave friend!
Say to the king the knowledge of the broil
As thou didst leave it.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Sergeant
SPEECH.LINE: Doubtful it stood;
As two spent swimmers, that do cling together
And choke their art. The merciless Macdonwald--
Worthy to be a rebel, for to that
The multiplying villanies of nature
Do swarm upon him--from the western isles
Of kerns and gallowglasses is supplied;
And fortune, on his damned quarrel smiling,
Show'd like a rebel's whore: but all's too weak:
For brave Macbeth--well he deserves that name--
Disdaining fortune, with his brandish'd steel,
Which smoked with bloody execution,
Like valour's minion carved out his passage
Till he faced the slave;
Which ne'er shook hands, nor bade farewell to him,
Till he unseam'd him from the nave to the chaps,
And fix'd his head upon our battlements.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DUNCAN
SPEECH.LINE: O valiant cousin! worthy gentleman!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Sergeant
SPEECH.LINE: As whence the sun 'gins his reflection
Shipwrecking storms and direful thunders break,
So from that spring whence comfort seem'd to come
Discomfort swells. Mark, king of Scotland, mark:
No sooner justice had with valour arm'd
Compell'd these skipping kerns to trust their heels,
But the Norweyan lord surveying vantage,
With furbish'd arms and new supplies of men
Began a fresh assault.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: DUNCAN
SPEECH.LINE: Dismay'd not this
Our captains, Macbeth and Banquo?

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. Court of Macbeth's castle.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter BANQUO, and FLEANCE bearing a torch before him

SPEECH.SPEAKER: BANQUO
SPEECH.LINE: How goes the night, boy?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FLEANCE
SPEECH.LINE: The moon is down; I have not heard the clock.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: BANQUO
SPEECH.LINE: And she goes down at twelve.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: FLEANCE
SPEECH.LINE: I take't, 'tis later, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: BANQUO
SPEECH.LINE: Hold, take my sword. There's husbandry in heaven;
Their candles are all out. Take thee that too.
A heavy summons lies like lead upon me,
And yet I would not sleep: merciful powers,
Restrain in me the cursed thoughts that nature
Gives way to in repose!
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: Enter MACBETH, and a Servant with a torch
SPEECH.LINE: Give me my sword.
Who's there?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MACBETH
SPEECH.LINE: A friend.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: BANQUO
SPEECH.LINE: What, sir, not yet at rest? The king's a-bed:
He hath been in unusual pleasure, and
Sent forth great largess to your offices.
This diamond he greets your wife withal,
By the name of most kind hostess; and shut up
In measureless content.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MACBETH
SPEECH.LINE: Being unprepared,
Our will became the servant to defect;
Which else should free have wrought.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: BANQUO
SPEECH.LINE: All's well.
I dreamt last night of the three weird sisters:
To you they have show'd some truth.
